Situation1: They have argued repeatedly this week about finances.
Expectation2: Communicate with pilots to provide instructions and updates
Situation2: Cloud tops are rising quickly, and several pilots await revised climb instructions.
Story: My phone buzzes again, lighting up with Mia’s name. We’ve argued about money every night this week, and she’s expecting me to call during my break, to finally talk things through. I know she wants reassurance, a plan, some sign that I’m listening. But right now, I’m staring at the radar, watching cloud tops surge higher than forecasted. Three pilots are waiting for my revised climb instructions, their voices tense over the radio. I can’t afford a mistake—one wrong call and lives are at stake. My headset presses into my ears, the room humming with static and clipped voices. My heart pounds, torn between the urgent blinking of my phone and the blinking lights on my screen. Mia needs me to be present, to fix what’s broken between us. The pilots need me to be precise, to keep them safe. I grip the edge of the console, feeling the weight of both worlds pressing in, knowing I can’t be in two places at once.
